The claim made by New York State Attorne: 2. The data from the Centers for Disease Control (CDC) that shows eight states - Alabama, Arkansas, Tennessee, West Virginia, Mississippi, Oklahoma, Kentucky, and Louisiana - reported more opioid prescriptions than residents in 2015.
